problem: I won a trip for four to the Super Bowl.  I can bring three of my friends.  I have 8 friends.  In how many ways can I form my Super Bowl party?
solution: Order does not matter, so it is a combination. Choosing $3$ out of $8$ is $\binom{8}{3}=\boxed{56}.$
model_solution:
Select 3 friends out of 8 to attend the party. 

C(8, 3) = ?
C(8, 3) = 8! / (3! \* (8-3)!)
= 8! / (3! \* 5!)
= (8 \* 7 \* 6) / (3 \* 2 \* 1)
= 56
The party is now formed, so there are 56 possible parties.
The three selected friends can be arranged in any order, so there are 3! ways to arrange them.

3! = 3 × 2 × 1 = 6
Multiply the number of possible parties by the number of ways to arrange them: 56 × 6 = 336
Multiply the number of possible parties by the number of ways to arrange them: 336 × 4 = 1344
Account for the fact that I can also attend the party.
Divide the current total by 4 (to account for the fact that I can also attend the party) and multiply by 4: 1344 / 4 × 4 = 1344 × 1 = 1344 (Final Answer)
